Reviews.Title: “Lives up to its reputation”
Reviews.Author: CAMAROSA
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location just a few stops from the main railway station and good connections by underground and bus to the rest of the city. Private family run hotel. Lovely breakfast, gorgeous soft duvets and pillows. Nothing really fancy but clean, spacious room with showers. Free internet access from the reception area. Efficient service. Quite a few food choices in the street.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Fudgecat0250
Reviews.Content: Coveniently located hotel fairly close to main station and just 2 minutes from nearest underground station with links everywhere, and within walking distance of the main tourist attractions. The hotel is clean with friendly, helpful staff, but the bar area is almost non-existant, certainly not big enough to seat four people comfortably. The breakfasts are excellent. The room was fine, comfortable but with a very compact bathroom. All-in-all, good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely revisit”
Reviews.Author: FionaFoster
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a family of two adults and two children aged 13 and 10 in a family room, which was enormous! A double and two singles which suited our needs to a tee.. The bathroom was poorly designed, with two basins but the toilet tucked in a little corner, but clean and suited our needs perfectly adequately. Breakfast was great, with plenty to choose from, the staff were particularly friendly and helpful. We had a room overlooking the Tiergarten which I must admit the first night did affect our sleep but by the secind night we were so tired from our sight seeing that nothing could keep us awake!! So if you are really bothered ask for a room overlooking the courtyard, but if you want a view of the garden and accept that old buildings have character including the noise from the street then trust me you will soon get used to it.

Reviews.Title: “hospitality plus”
Reviews.Author: AJacob255060
Reviews.Content: What I remember most about our stay at this hotel were the courteous and helpful staff. For instance, at the large buffet breakfast each morning, they remember that I'd asked for a big mug for my tea and brought one to the table as soon as we sat down. The breakfast is generous. The hosts Stephan and son Benjamin are very friendly and informative and even when extremely busy, they are attentive and helpful. They have bicycles in their old and very cool cellar that you can rent for 10 euros a day. The rooms are basic with very high ceilings. They staff at the reception supply you with kettles or things you might need for your room. I didn't like the tiny shower cubicle and the fact that there was not enough lights in the room. the pillows were too thin. But on the upside, everything was spotless and towels are changed everyday. You can walk or ride to most major attractions from here. The biggest plus for us was the hotel's proximity to the gorgeous parklands. We took the TXL bus from the airport which dropped us a few meters from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel; Best Breakfast Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Wandertheworld2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is owned by the manager, therefore it has great service and he takes pride in his establishment. He was always willing to help. In addition, one of the best things was the wonderful buffet breakfast, included in our stay. It had the biggest selection of any on our travels throughout Germany and central Europe. Pretty little dining room too. The rooms here are not large and there was no air conditioning. It was located in a very good area, though, to walk to many places. Park was nice across the street. Grocery store just a half block away along with restaurants. All in all, a very nice place, and great value. Would definately stay again, just not at the warmest time of the year.

Reviews.Title: “Just returned from a fantastic stay here.”
Reviews.Author: PETER M
Reviews.Content: Staff are more than willing to explain travel arrangements around the city, rooms are extremely comfortable and spotless with towels changed daily. The breakfast has a fantastic selection to choose from to set you up for the day. TOP TIP. Purchase 72 Hour travel ticket for use on trains buses and underground.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JayneyMcIreland
Reviews.Content: I stayed here whilst i was on a school trip with my History pupils over the st Patricks day break. On a school trip i expected a very basic hotel, but this was not the case. I cant compliment this hotel enough and would certainly consider staying here if i return to berlin on a short trip.The hotel staff were all very helpful, so much so they accomodated us with rooms at 5 in the morn when we werent even expected until 8 that morning. The rooms were large and the beds were confortable, with snug quilts. The bathroom was excellent, we were in a room that was for disabled access as well so it was a wet room which was great. The hotel was a short walk from the subway which was really handy and made our trour around berlin so easy. The tickets can be bought from the hotel and are very cheap. 15 euro for 5 ppl for 24 hours. The best thing about this hotel however was the amazing breakfast. A very extensive contential breakfast, including hot food as well. I looked forward to my breakfast every day. The manager or owner not sure which, was more than helpful and very friendly. Any request was accomodated with ease. A great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, convenient hotel with excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: MELI09
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Tiergarten during the New Year's Holidays. We were two families with young children ,ages 7 to 9 . The first thing you realize is that the hotel is in an excellent location : the bus stop as well as the metro station are in a range of 3-5 min walk . Our rooms were in the front part of the building and with the windows closed at all times they were very quiet and warm. They were also very spacious, but looked a bit "old" despite the attempt to give a modern look in the decoration. The best thing about this hotel is the breakfast which is unexpectedly good ! The variety and the quality of the breakfast buffet could easily compete with those of a higher class hotel . Overall, I would say that Hotel Tiergarten is average. However, it is an excellent choice if your plan is to have a good breakfast and then spend all your day walking around Berlin .

Reviews.Title: “very memorable stay...”
Reviews.Author: monica389
Reviews.Content: Arrived on Wednes 8th December, staff were very nice, good english and could not be more helpful. Family room was huge and bathroom had separate shower and bath. Everything was spotlessly clean and the view was fabulous. The breakfast each morning was superb with a huge array of food to suit everyone. We visited alot of christmas markets and tourists attraction. The receptionist was very helpful in showing us the best markets to visit and best restaurants to eat in. I couldnt praise them enough for all the did for us. Definitely will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay - great team”
Reviews.Author: samiujan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Tiergarten hotel for 15 days - the rooms were very clean - the staff spruced up the place great everyday The best bit was the friendly and helpful advice from Benjamin and the staff on the best places to visit and shop in Berlin

Reviews.Title: “Helpful and friendly staff made an enjoyable stay.”
Reviews.Author: bricko055
Reviews.Content: Good location. Family owned with owner on hand made sure guests were well looked after. Good breakfast with plenty of fruit.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL STAY OF MY LIFE!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Amina3200
Reviews.Content: Okay, okay, location's all right, good breakfast, I know, but WHAT IS THE POINT IF YOU CANT SLEEP?! We stayed here for a few days and could not figure out why this hotel was given a high rating. It was so intensely hot in all the rooms--the only relief was by opening the windows, and that too it was only a few degrees cooler! We were sweating like crazy the entire day! The guest needs to be provided with some measure of comfort in order to do the sightseeing and activities they want to do, but here apparently comfort equals one lousy , tiny little fan that creates a breeze for about, oh, I don't know, a freaking FOOT!!!! And we had to push and fight to get that one useless fan! It's ridiculous! And later, after arguing with the rude and unhelpful owner, we managed to get a second fan, but that was our last night! He claimed he didn't care about "superficial" ratings and reviews. I mean, we couldn't sleep at night! Is this owner so stubborn he won't go out to buy a few decent fans for all his rooms? Do not stay here unless you hope to break the world record for most sleepless nights in a row!

Reviews.Title: “For me i feel like 4 stars Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Feluriti
Reviews.Content: What do you expected in a Hotel? Location: Near from Turmstrasse Metro Station and bus stop and U-Bahn Station ! Room: Spacious and with the most facilities (including bathroom) ! Cleanness: You have nothing to point ! Breakfast: The breakfast was outstanding--lots of fresh fruit and pastries !!! I just would like one thing: free wireless internet in rooms

Reviews.Title: “excellent 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: toffeebonbon
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week with my husband my sister and her fiancee. Very apprehensive about going to Germany on holiday. What a surprise. Berlin was wonderful. Our Hotel was in a very convenient place near to U-Bhan bus stops etc. We arrived late in the evening no problem at all. We were directed to our rooms via a lift. The rooms were quite big there was a shower but no bath which my husband likes because of his athritis.I asked about this the next day and was told that by the afternoon when we came back that they would move our cases and clothes to another room with a bath. Done no problem at all even though bath was a bit small!! The breakfast was excellent lots of choice a hot buffet and cold meats assorted breads cakes fruit have no complaint at all. The hotel staff were excellent and at reception we were able to buy tickets for the public transport. They were extremely helpful with directions etc. Also there was a list in your room of restaurants and bars nearby which they recommended and they were also very good. Would have no hesitation in recommending this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every single pennie-great location with warm hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Hectically_Peaceful
Reviews.Content: We were attending the ITB Berlin 2010 and was recommended by a friend to stay at this place, since it's a good value for money ,clean ,and located in a convenient area in Mitte ,Berlin. It was my first time as well, but no problem about getting assistance from the owner ,his son and the other staff. The room was clean and decent size for a city hotel. I personally was impressed by the accent of the old architecture (the building is really old some hundreds yeas old). The breakfast was meaty ,diverse, and qualified. They served ranging from grained wholeweat bread, cereal, yogurt, ham,several kind of cheese, fruits ,and etc. As for the business facility, the internet can be used up in the room, but I would opt to use briefly at the front area if you don't use that many hours. The price wasn't as expensive as we thought (but of course more expensive than in Thailand). I had stayed there for 3 days,and it went well with smooth services from the family run hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, welcoming hotel”
Reviews.Author: PedropeteGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Very good location only a very short walk from u station. Very welcoming on arrival. Helpful reception staff. Frequently cakes in reception for the guests which was a nice touch. Room was basic but spacious enough. The breakfast spread was fantastic with plentiful cheeses, meats, breads, a few hot options (not much but good for a continental breakfast), smoked salmon and even some chocolate! All in all a good hotel that gives very good value for money. If travelling to Berlin again I would certainly stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Its a small hotel, but room is spacious. Its cozy and has good location.”
Reviews.Author: Sandietje
Reviews.Content: Considering the price, this hotel offers good room. The room we got was quite big. Although the TV set in my room was not directly in front of the bed. There are also sofa and a couch in the room. The breakfast is also delicious although the waiter/waitress were a bit indifferent, but generally speaking its good. At night it would not be noisy and its very close to subway station. I think I would love to stay there again if next time I visit Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, friendly and helpful staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: spy21
Reviews.Content: We stay at the hotel whenever we visit Berlin. It's a lovely building with a classic style, attractive decor with a homely feel. The rooms are really spacious with tall ceilings and huge windows. And all the mod cons. The staff are very friendly and are happy to help with planning trips or advice on travel. The train station and bus stops are a short walk away. It’s very central providing easy access to the whole of Berlin. There is a tasty breakfast buffet with a big selection. Great value for money and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: TravelKamm
Reviews.Content: Stayed in early July. 80euro per night for small double. Chose this hotel for proximity to main train station- it's a quick taxi ride away. However, there is no air conditioning and during a hot summer night the staff had to "go to the basement" to find a fan for our room and they weren't happy to do so. I asked for extra pillow and the woman working the front desk was annoyed by that request as well. Since the hotel is on a main street, be sure to ask for a room on the back of the hotel facing the courtyard for a peaceful night.. Although the breakfast buffet has lots of food, not all of it is fresh. The guests can't possibly eat all that food each day so much of it must go back into the fridge each night; for example the pineapple was brown. Hotel has lots of character. Rooms were OK. Baths were clean, updated and fresh. Free internet access. For a three-star hotel, it is as expected.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Tichy_Pixie
Reviews.Content: I have visited Berlin 6 times during the past 11 years and have always stayed at this hotel. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The breakfast is something out of this world and the rooms are always spotlessly clean. If anyone was going to Berlin, I would recommend this hotel very highly. The location is fantastic. It is only a few minutes walk from Turmstrasse U-Bahn station, which is in turn two stops from the Zoo (main area in Berlin city centre). If your room is on the Alt Moabit, it can get a bit noisy due to traffic, but that is something that I love and really miss when I get back to the UK. There is a unique sound to the Berlin traffic and it has never kept me awake at night.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for a break in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: tarras
Reviews.Content: Stefan was very helpful right from the initial Email contact, giving us loads of very helpful information about getting there from airports etc. All the staff seemed to take their cue from him, ie they were helpful and friendly and obviously enjoyed working in the hotel. Our room at the front (no 18) was larger than we expected, regularly cleaned with comfortable beds and a modern shower unit. A little noise from the street didn't prevent us from sleeping. Breakfast was excellent with a full buffet of almost anything you might expect plus ample plates of fresh fruit. Pleasant street walks near the hotel - only a short distance to the Spree.Good cafés and restaurants within 5 mins walk. We bought Berlin-cards ( available at hotel) and could take the TXL bus from just outside the hotel, or the U-bahn from Turmstrasse, about 3 mins walk. Using these one could quickly reach the main tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money & location”
Reviews.Author: smcc1879
Reviews.Content: Good location, close to Turmstrasse U-Bahn. 10 min walk from Tiergarten park. Fantastic breakfast - wow. Rooms spacious and clean. Fiendly and welcoming staff. 10 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel For Everything”
Reviews.Author: MrMickR
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on TripAdvisor and booked directly with the hotel. There was 13 of us staying in Berlin for 2 nights and this place was just right. The rooms were big, clean and fully equipt and the staff were very helpful in everyway. As for the breakfast - well the reputation is true....first class options and quality. The location was brilliant too - far enough from the centre of Berlin to not be busy and expensive, but close enough to walk in Mitte if you like. There are U & S-Bahn stations very close and also there is a 24hr bar only a few steps away. Also the area has many other bars and restaurants. Really, whatever you are lookng for in a hotel - this works for everyone! Just book it!

Reviews.Title: “ann ireland”
Reviews.Author: barbaraIreland
Reviews.Content: 15th. june 2008 just returned from four day trip to Berlin. This hotel was ideal, really close to u bahn and handy for buses too., They offer the best breakfast you could imagine all sorts of cereals, juices ,and such a choice of fresh fruits also bacon sausage scrambled egg and too !. Sets you up for the day. The rooms are spotlessly clean and of ample size, as are the en suites. The front rooms face onto the busy road and can be noisy during the night .(there are only a few of these) insist on a room towards the back and it will be very peaceful all night.. The staff are helpful in finding some restaurants down nearby streets that you would really miss without help. A bonus is that down most of the side streets about 3/4 kilometre you will arrive at the riverside, which is a lovely walk. I felt it was a quiet safe area even in the evenings and you can actually walk t o the Brandenberg Gate from the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: gabhla
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, in convenient location close to both the S and U bahn. Excellent buffet breakfast in a clean , value for money hotel, situated a little bit off the centre, but good transport links. Strongly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: jim1664
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel in february and booked a room for three people. Hotel was located close to a tube station so travelling around Berlin was made very easy. The room itself was pretty basic - but you get what you pay for. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful and helped in everything from advice on where to go and eat/ drink to actually booking resturants for us. The breakfast is large and varied and will see you through till lunch easily. All in all the hotel is a good value, friendly and convieniently located for a visit to Berlin - definatly recommended

Reviews.Title: “A friendly oasis in the heart of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: CharlieDave
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Tiergarten is an unassuming, friendly and very conveniently located family owned hotel. Located in a typical 19th century apartment block, the majority of the rooms face onto a quiet inner courtyard. They are, typically, high ceilinged with an en-suite bathrooms carved out of a corner. There is nothing particularly grand about the rooms but the beds are comfortable, the rooms are reasonably large, and there's plenty of hanging space. Oh, and the prices are sensible. Breakfast is served in two wood - panelled dining rooms. The buffet encompasses everything from hot dishes through to cold beef and smoked salmon - a really amazing spread that will see you through the day. The hotel recommends a few of the local restaurants and, as the neighbourhood evolves (a large German ministry has opened next door), new eateries are opening up all the time. Secure off-street parking is easily arranged in a multi-storey car park a couple of doors away. There's a U-Bahn station close by and a much more useful S-Bahn station a short walk away. If you arrive by air, the airport bus stops outside the hotel. Basically, this hotel is ideal for the seasoned tourist who wants a simple base close to the centre of town.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: fmck49
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel directly via the internet and the staff couldn't have been more helpful then or during our stay. The buffet breakfast is excellent and fresh fruit is left on the landings every day. Both rooms were very clean and comfortable with good facilities and very quiet as the design of the hotel means most are away from the main road. Public transport is minutes away and the Reichstag is only 30 minutes on foot along the lovely riverside walk. There are several good restaurants close by too. We paid a little over £50 per night which was excellent value, particularly at this time of year. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “World cup heaven”
Reviews.Author: citybluemoon
Reviews.Content: Late post as we actually stayed during the world cup last June. I went with my 12 year old son. We stayed 3 nights at the hotel and had a fantastic time. Previously in Berlin we'd stayed at the Circus Hostel that was fabulous and so we were worried that this place wouldn't be up to our previous experience. However we had a brill time. It's about a 20 minute walk to the Reichstag and very close to the underground. The rooms were spacious and clean (albeit with a bizarre bathroom implant) and the building was full of character. The breakfasts were amazing. Across the street was an Argentine steakhouse that opened late so we ate there after the games - friendly staff. Berlin itself is a great city - will go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fiohna
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 days in Berlin at Hotel Tiergarten. (6-9 Dec) Very nice hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. Everything was very clean and comfortable and the shower was very good. Our rooms were not very spacious but he manager said if we come again we will get better rooms next time! It was fully booked when we stayed so it can't be helped. Breakfast was a very comprehensive buffet which was very good value as it was included in the room rate and we already had 3 nights for the price of 2. The rooms have a mini bar with reasonably priced drinks if you fancy a nightcap. Would recommend this hotel and if you want a bit of space and comfy chairs in your room ask for one of the bigger ones, but for a couple of days the smaller ones are fine. The staff witll order you a taxi if you want one, which comes in less than 5 mins or they will get out a map and help you find the right train to take!

Reviews.Title: “just the best”
Reviews.Author: poppytwo
Reviews.Content: What can we say to tell you what a great deal you get at this hotel that has not already been said. So lets just say it all again, fabulous. Ted and Jeannie

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: machar
Reviews.Content: I and 14 of my friends stayed here the weekend before Xmas 2005 (apologies for the late review!). I organised the accommodation through the Berlin tourist office and checked the reviews on here. All of my friends thought this was a great hotel so there another 14 people backing this review! The hotel was based just down from the underground and was easy to find once you knew what side of the road you were on! The welcome was really nice and they were ready for us all arriving at once. We got to pick our rooms from a list so certain smaller groups could be together. The rooms were a good size with a decent sized bathroom. We had a shower and the shower tray was rather deep so if you have short legs like me be careful! The rooms were warm and cosy as were the beds so no complaints there. The hotel was based beside some good resturants and the pub a couple of doors down on the corner became our local and our meeting point. The highlight of this hotel must be the breakfasts. The buffet was like nothing I had ever seen before. Acres of food, everything you could imagine - fruit, meat, cheese, sweets, bread, rolls, cornflakes, fish, fruit salads piled up on different levels. It looked like a church harvest display. If you stocked up at breakfast you didn't need to eat until the evening. The staff were really nice and coped admirably with so many of us bumbling about and asking questions all the time. I would recommend this hotel to anyone (except those looking for 4 star luxury) and I would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Tiergarten with my husband and two children and were well looked after. Hotel staff made us feel very welcome and spoke english which helped. Also very helpful with places to see and how to get there. Hotel room was very spacious and contained everything we needed for our 2 night stay. Also was easy to find and within walking distance from the places of interest. Breakfast buffet was absolutely lovely and kept us full till lunch time. Had a wonderful time in Berlin and at the Tiergarten and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and charming small hotel”
Reviews.Author: ISJ_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this small hotel with my partner and with several colleagues from different European countries with whom I needed to arrange a meeting one weekend in November. I can recommend this hotel very strongly to anyone who wants to stay in an atmospheric and charming small hotel with excellent service. The hotel building is converted from a set of nineteenth century apartments in a commercial and residential area of central Berlin - a very good place to experience the atmosphere of everyday Berlin, away from the tourists. It is not a highly luxurious hotel, but very carefully run and convenient, with attention to every detail. Breakfast is generous and excellent. We wanted to hold a small meeting at the hotel, and the manager and staff could not have been more helpful and obliging. While several other Berlin hotels I contacted wanted to charge us at high rates for just using a meeting routine for 6 people (we needed no other facilities), the Tiergarten staff were very happy to make their breakfast room available for our meeting for most of the day free of charge, and were very flexible about supplying us with coffee at minimal charge whenever we wanted it. The Tiergarten is now definitely my hotel of choice in Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “a first rate hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff all speak very good english so no problems with language. Our luggage was delayed but the staff were very helpful in tracing it. The buffet breakfast was out of this world and the rooms were allways clean.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent transport connections away from tourist bustle.”
Reviews.Author: Lynda
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a week, accompanying school group but would recommend it highly for families and individuals too. Large triples and quads make ideal for families. My single was a fair size with excellent lighting (a reading lamp at last!) and new bathroom. Incredible breakfast buffet with widest choice I've ever seen in 3 (or 4)star hotel. Staff are pleasant and helpful,with tips on transport, sights (and info on emergency room at hospital!) S-Bahn station Bellevue was nearby (pleasant walk by river then over the bridge) and we used it more than U-Bahn Turmstrasse which is right by the hotel. With S-Bahn you get to see the city and we found Friedrchstrasse a much less confusing station to connect at than Zoo. Both these stations 2 stops away. Short journeys (up to 3 stops) cost less: Kurzstreckenkarte. If you're doing more travelling the day ticket at 5.60 is better value (Kids up to 14 pay less). Even better value for group, Kleingruppenkarte at 14 euros covers 5 people for a day. Reception sells tickets and has maps of U & S-Bahn network, which you'll find essential!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel Tiergarten to be a wonderful hotel.The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. It was my first visit to Berlin and had no idea how to get around but was given maps of the bus stations and underground and was told in detail how to use the transport service.The hotel was close to the underground ( less than a 5 min walk) and the service is fast and efficent. The breakfast buffet was lovely and had so much choice.Even for me as a fussy eater!! When I go back to Berlin I will definatley be staying at the Tiergarten.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great City”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was the second time for me at this hotel, It is close to public transport (which is super efficient in Berlin) Staff are helpful & friendly, this is not a "chain" hotel, and there is an interest in the guests. Excellent B'fast buffet.Help with looking after luggage prior to departure. Staff also spoke English but then who doesn't in Germany? Rooms are well appointed, no tea making facilities was the only criticism I found.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Tiergarten
HotelInfo.Address: Alt-Moabit 89, 10559 Berlin, Germany
